TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract MailingLabel

remarks.para: Use the property to return the object.
Use the method to print a mailing label listed in the Product Number box in the Label Options dialog box.
Use the property to format or print a custom mailing label.

MemberSignature.Value: public int Creator { get; }
.property instance int32 Creator
Public ReadOnly Property Creator As Integer
public: property int Creator { int get(); };
member this.Creator : int

Docs.summary: Returns a 32-bit integer that indicates the application in which the specified object was created.

remarks.para: If the object was created in Microsoft Word, this property returns the hexadecimal number 4D535744, which represents the string "MSWD." This value can also be represented by the constant wdCreatorCode.

The Creator property was primarily designed to be used on the Macintosh, where each application has a four-character creator code. For example, Microsoft Word has the creator code MSWD. For additional information about this property, consult the language reference Help included with Microsoft Office Macintosh Edition.

MemberSignature.Value: public string DefaultLabelName { get; set; }
.property instance string DefaultLabelName
Public Property DefaultLabelName As String
public: property System::String ^ DefaultLabelName { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.DefaultLabelName : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the name for the default mailing label.

remarks.para: To find the string for the specified built-in label, select the label in the Label Options dialog box (Tools menu, Envelopes and Labels dialog box, Labels tab, Options button). Then click Details and look at the Label name box, which contains the correct string to use for this property. To set a custom label as the default mailing label, use the label name that appears in the Details dialog box, or use the property with a object.
Creating a new label document from a CustomLabel object automatically sets the DefaultLabelName property to the name of the CustomLabel object.

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the default paper tray that contains sheets of mailing labels.

remarks.para: The DefaultLaserTray property can be one of the constants.

Docs.summary: True if a POSTNET bar code is added to envelopes or mailing labels by default.

remarks.para: For U.S. mail only. For envelopes, this property must be set to True before the property is set.

Docs.summary: Displays the Label Options dialog box.

remarks.para: The LabelOptions method works only if the document is the main document of a mailing labels mail merge.

Docs.param: Optional Object. The mailing label name.
Optional Object. The text for the label address.
Optional Object. True to use the text marked by the "EnvelopeAddress" bookmark (a user-defined bookmark) as the label text. If this argument is specified, and are ignored.
Optional Object. The laser printer tray to be used. Can be any constant.
Optional Object. True to print a single label; False to print an entire page of the same label.
Optional Object. The label row for a single label. Not valid if is False.
Optional Object. The label column for a single label. Not valid if is False.
Optional Object. True to print postage using an Internet e-postage vendor.
Optional Object. True prints text vertically on the label. Used for Asian-language mailing labels.
Docs.summary: Prints a label or a page of labels with the same address.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool Vertical { get; set; }
.property instance bool Vertical
Public Property Vertical As Boolean
public: property bool Vertical { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: True vertically orients text on Asian envelopes and mailing labels.

remarks.para: This property works only with mailing labels or envelopes that are set up for a mail merge and applies only to Asian languages.
